abstract: <jats:p><jats:italic>Luzonichthys seaver</jats:italic>, n. sp., is described from two specimens, 42-46 mm standard length (SL) collected from Pohnpei, Micronesia. Collections were made by divers on mixed-gas closed-circuit rebreathers using hand nets at depths of 90-100 m. <jats:italic>Luzonichthys seaver</jats:italic> is distinct from all other species of the genus in the characters of lateral line scales, gill rakers, pelvic fin length, caudal concavity and coloration. Of the six species of <jats:italic>Luzonichthys</jats:italic>, it appears to be morphologically most similar to <jats:italic>L. earlei</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>L. whitleyi</jats:italic>.</jats:p>
title: Luzonichthys seaver, a new species of Anthiinae (Perciformes, Serranidae) from Pohnpei, Micronesia
